title: Watch Challenger TV: #NextGenATP stars Prizmic, Blockx & Cina in action
description: The ATP Challenger Tour is your home to watch the sport’s future stars, today. Lately, #NextGenATP standouts Dino Prizmic, Alexander Blockx and Federico Cina are among those who have been making a splash on the Challenger Tour and improving their position in the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah. To follow their journeys, fans can tune into Challenger TV to stream all ATP Challenger Tour matches live and on demand at no cost.Prizmic and Cina are in action this week at the Internazionali di Tennis San Marino Open, where 17-year-old Justin Engel is also competing. Prizmic, 19, went on a 14-match winning streak from May to July, claiming two Challenger titles in that span followed by a runner-up finish. The Croatian is fourth in the Race To Jeddah, behind Jakub Mensik, Joao Fonseca and Learner Tien. Blockx is seeded second at the Les Championnats Banque Nationale de Granby in Canada, with American Eliot Spizzirri leading the field. Blockx, a two-time Challenger champion, last week contested his third final at that level in Winnipeg, only falling to Canadian Liam Draxl. Denmark’s August Holmgren, who turned heads by reaching the third round of Wimbledon as a qualifier, is competing in Granby. Last week, #NextGenATP Croatia’s Matej Dodig claimed his maiden Challenger Tour trophy in Trieste. The 19-year-old, who is 13th in the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah, is playing this week at the Dutch Open Tournament in Bunschoten. View the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah Standings Prizmic, Blockx, Cina and Dodig are all seeking their maiden trips to the 20-and-under Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF, held in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia from 17-21 December. The Open Ciudad de Pozoblanco is also taking place this week, with Frenchman Hugo Grenier spearheading the field. American 17-year-old Darwin Blanch is among the #NextGenATP players in the draw. [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Tune into Challenger TV to stream all ATP Challenger Tour matches live and on demand for free.

html:
Challenger

Discover who is playing at this week's Challenger events

July 14, 2025

Bratislava Open/Stephen McGregor

Dino Prizmic and Alexander Blockx are competing on the ATP Challenger Tour this week. By ATP Staff

The ATP Challenger Tour is your home to watch the sport’s future stars, today.

Lately, #NextGenATP standouts Dino Prizmic, Alexander Blockx and Federico Cina are among those who have been making a splash on the Challenger Tour and improving their position in the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah.

To follow their journeys, fans can tune into Challenger TV to stream all ATP Challenger Tour matches live and on demand at no cost.

Prizmic and Cina are in action this week at the Internazionali di Tennis San Marino Open, where 17-year-old Justin Engel is also competing. Prizmic, 19, went on a 14-match winning streak from May to July, claiming two Challenger titles in that span followed by a runner-up finish. The Croatian is fourth in the Race To Jeddah, behind Jakub Mensik, Joao Fonseca and Learner Tien.

Blockx is seeded second at the Les Championnats Banque Nationale de Granby in Canada, with American Eliot Spizzirri leading the field. Blockx, a two-time Challenger champion, last week contested his third final at that level in Winnipeg, only falling to Canadian Liam Draxl. Denmark’s August Holmgren, who turned heads by reaching the third round of Wimbledon as a qualifier, is competing in Granby.

Last week, #NextGenATP Croatia’s Matej Dodig claimed his maiden Challenger Tour trophy in Trieste. The 19-year-old, who is 13th in the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah, is playing this week at the Dutch Open Tournament in Bunschoten.

View the PIF ATP Live Race To Jeddah Standings

Prizmic, Blockx, Cina and Dodig are all seeking their maiden trips to the 20-and-under Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF, held in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia from 17-21 December.

The Open Ciudad de Pozoblanco is also taking place this week, with Frenchman Hugo Grenier spearheading the field. American 17-year-old Darwin Blanch is among the #NextGenATP players in the draw.
